50.verse: Possession and Division of Canaan. -On the plain of Moab near the Jordan, across from Jericho, the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

51.verse: “Speak to the people of Israel and say to them, ‘When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan

52.verse: drive out the inhabitants of the land before you. Destroy all of their carved images and all of their cast idols. Demolish all of their high places.

53.verse: Take possession of the land and live in it, for I have given you the land to possess.

54.verse: Distribute the land by lot among your families. Give a larger inheritance to those that are larger and a smaller inheritance to those that are smaller. Wherever the lot falls, give it to them. Distribute it according to your ancestral tribes.

55.verse: But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land, then those whom you leave will become splinters in your eyes and thorns in your sides. They will harass you in the land in which you dwell.’ ”

56.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

1.verse: Chapter 34 -Canaan’s Boundaries. -The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

2.verse: “Command the people of Israel and say to them, ‘When you come into the land of Canaan, this is the land that will fall to you as an inheritance: the land of Canaan to its borders.

3.verse: “ ‘Your southern section will run from the Desert of Zin along the border of Edom. Your southern border will be along the eastern coast of the Salt Sea.

4.verse: Your border in the south will extend from the Ascent of Akrabbim on to Zin, and then passing on the south of Kadesh-barnea on to Hazar-addar and Azmon.

5.verse: From Azmon the border will stretch to the Wadi of Egypt, ending where it enters the sea.

6.verse: “ ‘Your western border will be the great sea. This will be your western border.

7.verse: “ ‘Your northern border will run from the great sea to Mount Hor.

8.verse: From Mount Hor it will run to the Pass of Hamath. The border will then run to Zedad.

9.verse: The border will continue on to Ziphron and it will end at Hazar-enan. This will be your northern border.

10.verse: “ ‘Your eastern border will run from Hazar-enan to Shepham.

11.verse: The border will run down from Shepham to Riblah on the eastern side of Ain. The border will run down until it reaches the eastern shore of the Sea of Chinnereth.

12.verse: The border will run down along the Jordan until it enters the Salt Sea. This will be your land, with your borders on every side.’ ”

13.verse: Moses commanded the people of Israel, saying, “This is the land that you will inherit by lot, as the Lord commanded. Give it to the nine and one-half tribes.

14.verse: The tribe of the Reubenites, according to their ancestral tribe, has received their inheritance. The tribe of the Gadites, according to their ancestral tribe, as well as the half-tribe of Manasseh, have received their inheritance.

15.verse: The two and one-half tribes have received their inheritance across the Jordan, opposite Jericho, to the east, toward the direction of sunrise.”

16.verse: Appointed Leaders. -The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

17.verse: “The names of the men who will divide the land for you are: Eleazar the priest and Joshua, the son of Nun.

18.verse: You will choose one leader from each tribe to divide the land for inheritance.

19.verse: These are the names of the men: from the tribe of Judah: Caleb, the son of Jephunneh;

20.verse: from the tribe of Simeon: Samuel, the son of Ammihud;

21.verse: from the tribe of Benjamin: Elidad, the son of Chislon;

22.verse: from the tribe of Dan, a leader: Bukki, the son of Jogli;

23.verse: from the tribe of Joseph, from the tribe of Manasseh, a leader: Hanniel, the son of Ephod;

24.verse: from the tribe of Ephraim, a leader: Kemuel, the son of Shiphtan;

25.verse: from the tribe of Zebulun, a leader: Elizaphan, the son of Parnach;

26.verse: from the tribe of Issachar, a leader: Paltiel, the son of Azzan;

27.verse: from the tribe of Asher, a leader: Ahihud, the son of Shelomi;

28.verse: from the tribe of Naphtali, a leader: Pedahel, the son of Ammihud.”

29.verse: These are the ones whom the Lord commanded to divide the inheritance of the people of Israel in the land of Canaan.

1.verse: Chapter 35 -The Levites’ Share. -The Lord spoke to Moses in the plain of Moab near the Jordan, across from Jericho, saying,

2.verse: “Command the people of Israel to give cities to the Levites from the inheritance that they will possess. Also give the Levites pastures around the cities.

3.verse: They are to have cities in which they can dwell as well as pastures for their cattle, their flocks, and all their other animals.

4.verse: The pastures that you will give the Levites around the cities will extend one thousand cubits from the city wall.

5.verse: “Outside of the city, measure two thousand cubits on the east side, two thousand cubits on the south side, two thousand cubits on the west side, and two thousand cubits on the north side, with the city in the middle. This will be the pastures for the city.

6.verse: “Six of the cities that you give to the Levites will be established as cities of refuge to which a person who has killed another can flee. In addition, there are to be another forty-two cities.

7.verse: In all you will give the Levites forty-eight cities along with their pastures.

8.verse: The cities that you will give the Levites from the possession of Israel will be given according to the inheritance that they have inherited. Those who have more will give more and those who have less will give less.”

9.verse: Cities of Refuge. -The Lord said to Moses,

10.verse: “Speak to the people of Israel and say to them, ‘When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,

11.verse: choose cities that will be your cities of refuge to which a person who has accidentally killed another person can flee.

12.verse: These will be cities of refuge from the kinsman avenger so that the killer will not die until he has received judgment before the assembly.

13.verse: These six cities that you give will be your cities of refuge.

14.verse: Give three cities across the Jordan and give three cities in the land of Canaan to be your cities of refuge.

15.verse: These six cities will be a refuge for the people of Israel, for foreigners, and for foreigners dwelling among them, to which a person who has killed accidentally can flee.

16.verse: Treatment of Murderers. -“ ‘If someone strikes another with an iron object to kill him, then he is a murderer. The murderer will be put to death.

17.verse: If someone strikes another with a stone in his hand to kill him, then he is a murderer. The murderer will be put to death.

18.verse: If someone strikes another with a wooden object in his hand to kill him, then he is a murderer. The murderer will be put to death.

19.verse: The kinsman avenger of blood will kill him. When he meets the murderer, he will put him to death.

20.verse: If anyone pushes another person out of hatred or lays in wait and throws something at him in order to kill him,

21.verse: or if with bitterness he strikes someone with his hand in order to kill him, then that person will be put to death, for he is a murderer. The kinsman avenger of blood will kill the murderer when he meets him.

22.verse: “ ‘But if someone without bitterness pushes another person or throws something at him without his lying in wait,

23.verse: or he has a deadly stone object and he does not see the other, but drops it on him causing him to die, and he was not an enemy nor was he seeking to harm the other person,

24.verse: then the assembly will judge between the killer and the kinsman avenger of blood according to these ordinances:

25.verse: the assembly will save the killer from the hands of the kinsman avenger of blood. The assembly will send him back to the city of refuge to which he fled. He will live in it until the death of the high priest who was anointed with holy oil.

26.verse: “ ‘But if the killer at any time crosses over the boundary of the city of refuge to which he has fled,

27.verse: and the kinsman avenger of blood finds him outside of the boundary of the city of refuge, and the kinsman avenger of blood kills the killer, he will not be considered to have blood guilt.

28.verse: He should have remained in the city of refuge until the death of the high priest. After the death of the high priest, the killer can return to the land of his possession.

29.verse: These things will be a statute and an ordinance for you for all of your generations and in all of your dwellings.

30.verse: “ ‘If a person kills another, the murderer will be put to death upon the testimony of witnesses. But no one is to be put to death on the testimony of a single witness.

31.verse: You are not to accept a ransom for the murderer who is guilty of death; he is to be put to death.

32.verse: You are not to take a ransom from someone who has fled to his city of refuge who wants to return to live in the land before the death of the priest.

33.verse: “ ‘You are not to pollute the land in which you live, for blood pollutes the land, and the land cannot be cleansed of the blood that is shed upon it except through the blood of the person who shed it.

34.verse: You are not to pollute the land in which you dwell, for I dwell in it; I, the Lord, dwell among the people of Israel.’ ”

1.verse: Chapter 36 -The Daughters of Zelophehad. -The family heads of the clan of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, who were from the clans of the descendants of Joseph, came and spoke before Moses, before the leaders, and before the family heads of the people of Israel.

2.verse: They said, “When the Lord commanded my lord to give the land as an inheritance by lot to the people of Israel, the Lord commanded my lord to give the inheritance of our brother Zelophehad to his daughters.

3.verse: If they marry members of another Israelite tribe, then the inheritance of our ancestral tribe will be added to the inheritance of the tribe into which they have married. It will be taken from the portion of our inheritance.

4.verse: During the Jubilee of the people of Israel their inheritance will be added to the inheritance of the tribe into which they were received. Thus, their inheritance will be taken away from the inheritance of our ancestral tribe.”

5.verse: Moses commanded the people of Israel according to the word of the Lord, saying, “The tribe of Joseph is correct in what they have said.

6.verse: This is what the Lord has commanded concerning the daughters of Zelophehad: ‘Let them marry whomever they wish, only they are to marry within the ancestral tribe of their father.

7.verse: Thus, no inheritance among the people of Israel will be transferred from one tribe to another. The people of Israel will hold on to the inheritance of their ancestral tribe.

8.verse: Every daughter who comes into the possession of an inheritance of any tribe among the people of Israel will marry someone from the family of the tribe of her father. This way, each Israelite will inherit the inheritance of his fathers.

9.verse: No inheritance will pass from one tribe to another. Each Israelite tribe is to keep its own inheritance.’ ”

10.verse: Zelophehad’s daughters did as the Lord had commanded Moses.

11.verse: Zelophehad’s daughters, Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah, married their cousins on their father’s side.

12.verse: They married within the clans of the tribe of Manasseh, the son of Joseph. Their inheritance remained within their clan and their tribe.

13.verse: These are the commandments and the ordinances that the Lord commanded the people of Israel through Moses while they were in the plain of Moab, near the Jordan, across from Jericho.
